notes.text: A stronger variant of Brutal Strike , deals about four times more damage. Designed as an opening or finishing move due the long cooldown and high mana cost. When used by a high level knight during Blood Rage , Annihilation can hit for over 1000 damage.

A weaker variant of Flame Strike . This spell can be learned for free from any sorcerer or druid trainer on the mainland. A very helpful spell for players without a Premium Account , as they do not have access to regular Strike spells.

A weaker version of Conjure Arrow , the spell that creates 10 Arrows . It used to be obtainable exclusively on Dawnport . However, it was made freely obtainable on mainland on November 19th, 2014, thanks to a successful proposal by Trimegis .

The avatar form benefits from damage reduction and all its attacks are Critical Hits with extra critical damage. This is a Revelation Perk granted through the Wheel of Destiny . Therefore, it has no gold cost and is not learned from any specific NPC .

The avatar form benefits from damage reduction and all its attacks are Critical Hits with extra critical damage. This is a Revelation Perk granted through the Wheel of Destiny . Therefore, it has no gold cost and is not learned from any specific NPC .

The avatar form benefits from damage reduction and all its attacks are Critical Hits with extra critical damage. This is a Revelation Perk granted through the Wheel of Destiny . Therefore, it has no gold cost and is not learned from any specific NPC .

The avatar form benefits from damage reduction and all its attacks are Critical Hits with extra critical damage. This is a Revelation Perk granted through the Wheel of Destiny . Therefore, it has no gold cost and is not learned from any specific NPC .

The avatar form benefits from damage reduction and all its attacks are Critical Hits with extra critical damage. This is a Revelation Perk granted through the Wheel of Destiny . Therefore, it has no gold cost and is not learned from any specific NPC .

One of the most commonly used abilities for knights . Its damage dealt depends on the weapon's attack value and the chosen weapon skill level. Like with any attack, an Ice Rapier will break if you use this ability.

You can't use this and Protector spell at the same time, one spell will cancel the other. Blood Rage increases only the base fighting skill and loyalty skill points, it doesn't affect the bonus from weapons and equipment.
This spell is useful to cast before facing a creature that would otherwise drain all your mana, such as a Priestess or Dwarf Geomancer . A Fierce Berserk with a blood raged character, tested at the testerver.(PvM) A Fierce Berserk with a blood raged character, tested at the testerver.(PvP)
Bruise Bane is the Knight's only spell on Dawnport . It was made freely available on mainland on November 19th, 2014, thanks to a successful proposal by Trimegis .

This ability's damage potential depends on the weapon's attack value and the chosen weapon skill level and at maximum, tends to be about 50% of maximum auto-attack damage. Brutal Strike has a range of 1 square meter, meaning it can only hit targets in melee range. The animation will change depending on the weapon type you are wielding. It will look like throwing a Blacksteel Sword when wielding a sword , a Royal Axe when wielding an axe and a Cranial Basher when wielding a club .

A weaker version of Energy Strike . It used to be obtainable exclusively on Dawnport . However, it was made freely available on the mainland on November 19th, 2014, thanks to a successful proposal by Trimegis . This spell is taught to sorcerers on Dawnport and can also be learned for free from any sorcerer trainer on the mainland. A very helpful spell for players without a Premium Account , as they do not have access to regular Strike spells.

This spell is basically useless against monsters because they usually cast Invisible again in few seconds, but if used against a player it may be useful as they might not have enough mana to cast it again. When you're playing on Hardcore PvP , Retro Open PvP or Retro Hardcore PvP game worlds, this spell may break the enemy's stealth ring , if he's using one. It has the same range as the Mass Healing spell.
This spell was implemented as a "replacement" for the Energy Ring , which became restricted to Paladins and Knights when it was created.

This spell is mostly used in team hunts to keep creatures from targeting the rest of the team. It can also prevent creatures from running in low health (e.g. Nightmares ), making it useful for knights hunting alone. 
If a creature's path to the caster is blocked, creatures might change their target before the spell's duration is over. Summoned creatures are unaffected by this spell as they will attack what their owner targets. Players are not affected by this spell. This Spell can only be purchased by Elite Knights .
Can be used to run away from a monster that's too strong.

A weaker variant of Ice Wave and the druid 's equivalent of the sorcerer 's Scorch . It used to be obtainable exclusively on Dawnport . However, it was made freely available on the mainland on November 19th, 2014, thanks to a successful proposal by Trimegis .

This spell is similar to the Royal Paladin's Divine Dazzle with the difference that it challenges affected ranged creatures. It is useful in team hunts to avoid distance fighter creatures from targeting the rest of the team, as well as preventing creatures from running in low health, making it also useful for knights when solo-hunting this type of creature. It's important to note that it will only hit up to 3 creatures, whereas Challenge can hit up to 8. Furthermore, it cannot be used in rooms of Lever Bosses to prevent boss mechanics from becoming easier than originally intended. These two factors mean that Knights should still have Challenge ready to be used even after they acquire Chivalrous Challenge. If a creature's path to the caster is blocked, creatures might change their target before the spell's duration is over. Summoned creatures are unaffected by this spell as they will attack what their summoner targets. Players are not affected by this spell.

Requires 1 Soul Point per 10 arrows. This is a useful spell for Paladins . If you are hunting less dangerous creatures at lower levels and you do not need the mana for healing, use this spell to make more ammunition so you can hunt longer. Also, while training with spears, you can use your steady mana gain to store up surplus arrows and avoid having to buy them from the store. Make sure you have a free space in your backpack and enough carrying capacity (7 oz ) so you do not drop arrows on the ground (where they can be stolen by other players).

Requires 3 Soul Points to make 8 Burst Arrows . Useful spell for paladins that lets them create arrows, which cause Physical damage.  After the Summer 2007 update, the Burst Arrows deal damage based on Distance Fighting and level, making them much more useful to Paladins than before.
This spell replaced Enchant Staff spell.

Used only for fun, this spell only allows your shape to be changed, your name is still there along with your level, such as when you "look" at someone. Only your appearance is transformed into that of a creature by this spell, so real creatures still know you are a human and your name still appears above your character so other players are able to tell that it is just an illusion. Good for scaring Newbies . If the creature's name has a space in it, enclose it with quotation marks. Some people like to use this spell to make it look like they have a certain outfit . For example, transforming into an Assassin would make the spellcaster look like he/she has the Assassin Outfit . Another common use of this spell is similar to the Chameleon Rune for example, when a player is on another floor and sees you using this spell, if he doesn't look at you, he will think you are a random monster. See List of Illusionable Creatures for a complete list of creatures available with this spell.

This spell takes into account the Level and Magic Level to determine how much damage it will deal to the target. The damage is a series of constant values, where each value is followed by a 20% higher next value. The damage is the same for both creatures and players. The last damage value, the final dreadful peak, is calculated by multiplying the last damage value with a percentage ranging from 1 to 120%.
One of the most often used spells when fighting creatures vulnerable to death damage , as it deals relatively high damage and costs very little mana.
This spell is very useful when you are surrounded by monsters that deal a lot of damage but do not have a lot of health (for example orc berserkers or minotaur guards ).

This spell is very similar to the Knight's Chivalrous Challenge , however, it will not make the creatures change their target. This spell cannot be used in rooms of Lever Bosses to prevent boss mechanics from becoming easier than originally intended.

Unlocking it at higher stages will increase the damage damage buff and decrease its cooldown .
This is a Revelation Perk granted through the Wheel of Destiny . Therefore, it has no gold cost and is not learned from any specific NPC .

Damage increases with higher spell stages, and is not affected by damage buffs received after the grenade has been planted. Unlocking higher stages will decrease its cooldown . If the player has a target that is 4 squares or less away, the Grenade will be placed at the target's feet. Otherwise, it will be placed at the location the caster is. This is a Revelation Perk granted through the Wheel of Destiny . Therefore, it has no gold cost and is not learned from any specific NPC . The damage of the grenade is calculated the moment you cast it and not when it explodes.
This is an improved Ultimate Healing spell.

One of the main offensive spells used by paladins . Serves the same purpose as Ethereal Spear , compared to which it costs 5 mana less and deals slightly more damage, but has a shorter range of only 4 squares.

This spell takes into account the Level and Magic Level to determine how many turns it will deal damage to the target. The time it takes to execute the next damage turn, varies from 10 to 12 seconds. If the target is neutral to energy damage, it does 25 damage to creatures, and only half (13 damage rounded), to players.
At least one other party member has to stand in the spell's area of effect for it to work.
Requires 3 Soul Points per 1 Enchanted Spear .

The average damage is roughly 50% higher than that of Energy Strike . Great Energy Beam in turn, deals about 50% more damage than this spell and has a 3 squares longer range. For that reason, Energy Beam is rarely used.

Energy Strike is the lowest-levelled Strike spell and as such, typically the first that the player learns. One of the most often used spells when fighting creatures vulnerable to energy damage , as it deals relatively high damage and costs very little mana.

One of the strongest spells available to sorcerers . Even though Great Energy Beam has a longer range, Energy Wave is easier to hit with, due to the attack dealing damage in a wide cone, rather than in a straight line. Overall however, both spells serve the same purpose. Energy Wave is the sorcerer 's equivalent of the druid 's Terra Wave and Strong Ice Wave . Although it has a longer cooldown than Terra Wave, it also has a lower mana cost and deals about 25% more damage. Compared to Strong Ice Wave, it has a longer range.

This spell mainly takes the Magic Level into account while Level provides a very small factor to determine how much damage you will deal to the target. To players it does only half of the damage it would do to creatures. For example, at Magic Level 110 the damage to a monster that is neutral to earth in average starts at 84. In total summing up to 1700 HP after 400 seconds.

This spell, together with Wrath of Nature , replaced the old Poison Storm spell in the Winter Update 2007 . Eternal Winter is considered to be more useful overall, because, even though it costs 350 mana more, it deals higher damage and many high-levelled monsters are vulnerable to ice damage . Eternal Winter is the druid 's equivalent of the sorcerer 's Hell's Core , compared to which it costs 50 mana less, but has a smaller area of effect and deals about 10% less damage. Casting this spell puts ALL combat spells on a 4-second cooldown.

One of the main offensive spells used by paladins . Serves the same purpose as Divine Missile , compared to which it costs 5 mana more and deals slightly less damage, but its astonishing range of 7 squares enables the paladin to hit any target on the screen. Unlike the similarly named spell Enchant Spear , Ethereal Spear does not require any weapon or item to be cast.

It deals additional damage to targets with less than 30% of their hit points . Unlocking it at higher stages increases the damage dealt and number of additional targets, while decreasing cooldown. This is a Revelation Perk granted through the Wheel of Destiny . Therefore, it has no gold cost and is not learned from any specific NPC .

Creatures can only suffer from one instance of Expose Weakness at a time, which means that the effect cannot be stacked even if two or more sorcerers use it at the same time. Unlike other area spells, the center of the affected area is the target creature, and the caster if no target is set. This spell has no effect against other characters. This is one of the spells added with the Vocation Adjustments 2020 . It's main object is to make Sorcerers more meaningful and distinct during team hunts. This spell increases damage taken by 4% while under the effects of it. For example, a creature that takes 10% damage from death will take 14% damage while under the effects of this spell. However, if a creature is completely immune to an element, it will still be immune.
Fair Wound Cleansing is an upgrade to Wound Cleansing (healing approximately twice the amount of health) and the primary healing spell for Knights that can use it.

A stronger variant of Berserk . It is much less efficient, dealing slightly less than double damage while costing almost three times more mana. Used when damage output is more important than mana-efficiency.

This spell indicates the direction in a similar way to how Find Person indicates the direction of a character's location. In case there is less than 15 minutes for the fiendish creature to turn back into a regular creature, this spell will also indicate how much time left for this to happen. In case there is no fiendish creature alive at the moment, the following message will be displayed at the bottom of the Game Window : At the moment there is no fiend with special loot roaming this world. In this case, another fiendish creature will spawn within the next 5 minutes. This spell will also indicate the bestiary difficulty category of the monster if the relevant bestiary entry is completed, otherwise it will indicate a difficulty of "unknown"

If the player's name consists of only one word, you may omit the quotation marks. A players name can be shorted using the ~ symbol, e.g Exiva "Daron Digur" = Exiva Daron~ . Its useful to locate friends during hunts or enemies during wars . Note that when you are trying to exiva a CipSoft Member you cannot use the ~ symbol. Since the Summer Update 2007 , using the spell on a character who is offline, does not exist on the game world or is ambiguous in using the ~ wildcard, will still consume 20 mana. In other words, casting this spell will always cost mana, working or not. Before March 2015(?) the Find Person spell would not exhaust players if the player was not online or did not exist on the game world; this would allow players to spend a lot of mana in a short time, primarily to contribute to magic level. Results explanation When the player you exiva... * From Mathias Bynens 's article on TibiaMaps.io . The exiva spell is not working as a circle like most of the people think, it's working in a square like Bendergender proved in this program: The purple square marks the normal range " ... is to the ... " The red square marks the far range " ... is far to the ... " Everything beyond the red area means the target " ... is very far to the... " Exiva by Bendergender

The sorcerer 's equivalent of the druid 's Ice Wave . A helpful spell due to its wide area of effect. It can be cast repeatedly because of its low mana cost. It deals roughly 25% less damage than a Great Fireball Rune .
One of the most often used spells when fighting creatures vulnerable to fire damage , as it deals relatively high damage and costs very little mana.
Obtained when using the Shrine of Eterninty in the Kilmaresh Mountains during The Way of the Monk Quest .

Uses 1 Soul Point per cast. This spell is useful to raise your Magic Level at the start because you can recover some mana with the food it creates. It is always useful since you can create food if you run out of it far from cities or food sources. This spell creates one or two food items among the following: Grape , Bread , Roll , Cheese , Apple , Meat or Ham . Ham and Meat items will give you enough mana to cast again (also bread, if you're promoted). However, the combination of two food items may add up to sufficient mana. See this research from Tibia-Stats for a more detailed breakdown of this spell.
Obtained when using the Shrine of Knowledge in the Black Serpent Dungeon during The Way of the Monk Quest .
The amount of damage dealt depends on the weapon's attack value and the chosen weapon skill level. It is stronger than Berserk , but weaker than Fierce Berserk .

If an attack were to kill you but the overkill damage amounts to less than a certain percentage of your maximum health , you will first heal yourself for that same percentage of hit points and only afterwards will the damage be applied. In addition, all your spell cooldowns are reduced by 60 seconds. Attacks that deal agony damage do not trigger this perk. It is technically not a spell, is casted automatically when the effect triggers, and costs no mana. The cooldown of this perk is only reduced while the character has this perk available and has a battle sign . The cooldown timer will stop going down immediately when the battle sign is lost, either because one minute passed since it was triggered or because the character has entered a Protection Zone . The current cooldown can be checked by adding Gift of Life to an action button (right click and select "Assign Passive Ability"). This is a Revelation Perk granted through the Wheel of Destiny . Therefore, it has no gold cost and is not learned from any specific NPC .

This spell is granted through  the Beam Mastery Revelation Perk of the Wheel of Destiny . Therefore, it has no gold cost and is not learned from any specific NPC . Unlocking higher stages of the Beam Mastery will increase its damage, length, and decrease the cooldown . See more stats below. Damage wise, Stage 1 will deal damage around 100-160% of your Sudden Death Rune damage. The beam will reach 3 sqm outside the grid line while your character is facing north or south, or 2 sqm outside visual reach.

A stronger variant of Energy Beam , deals about 50% more damage on average. It was a somewhat weak spell before the major revision of the magic system, but now it is one of the strongest spells available to sorcerers . In the update that implemented the Skill Wheel it became even stronger, dealing more damage than even Energy Wave .

The sorcerer 's equivalent of the druid 's Strong Ice Wave . A helpful spell due to its wide area of effect and high damage. It deals more damage than a Great Fireball Rune and approximately the same as Strong Flame Strike .

Replaced Great Fireball Runes for knights in the Summer Update 2007 because of a major decrease in their damage output. It has been nicknamed as "bug spray", as knights often use it to kill groups of weak monsters like wolves or spiders due to its larger area of effect and lower damage than Berserk .

It's useful to escape from strong monsters that you don't want to fight like Giant Spiders or Ancient Scarabs . When needing to travel a long distance, this can help out a lot in decreasing the traveling time. However, in some cases this spell wont affect the traveling time, see Speed Breakpoints for more information.

This spell is really useful if you are hunting with a knight because you can heal him by saying Exura Sio " Player Name . Note: that if the person's name consists of only one word, the quotation marks can be omitted. It heals an amount of hp depending on your level and magic level .

The needed mana to cast this spell depends on the amount of party members that will be affected as shown on the following equation: m a n a c o s t = 120  0.9 X  1  X {\displaystyle mana cost = 120 \cdot 0.9^{X-1} \cdot X} Where X is the amount of party members within range, including yourself.

This spell, together with Rage of the Skies , replaced the old Ultimate Explosion spell in the Winter Update 2007 . Hell's Core is considered to be less useful overall, due to dealing virtually equal damage, while costing almost twice as much mana and the fact that many high-levelled monsters are immune to fire damage . Hell's Core is the sorcerer 's equivalent of the druid 's Eternal Winter , compared to which it costs 50 mana more, but has a larger area of effect and deals about 10% more damage. Casting this spell puts ALL combat spells on a 4-second cooldown.

This spell takes into account the Level and Magic Level to determine how many turns it will deal damage to the target. The time it takes to execute the next damage turn, varies from 10 to 12 seconds, but as soon as this spell is cast, the time will be the same for all the following turns. If the target is neutral to holy damage, it does 20 damage to creatures, and half of that (10 damage), to players.

Unlocking it at higher stages grants additional damage to targets with more than 60% of their hit points , and reduces its cooldown . This is a Revelation Perk granted through the Wheel of Destiny . Therefore, it has no gold cost and is not learned from any specific NPC .

One of the most often used spells when fighting creatures vulnerable to ice damage , as it deals relatively high damage and costs very little mana. An important spell for sorcerers , as it is the only instant spell that deals ice damage that they have access to and as such, it is incredibly helpful when fighting creatures like dragons and demons .

The druid 's equivalent of the sorcerer 's Fire Wave . A helpful spell due to its wide area of effect. It can be cast repeatedly because of its low mana cost. It deals roughly 25% less damage than an Avalanche Rune .

This spell takes into account the Level and Magic Level to determine how many turns it will deal damage to the target. The time it takes to execute the next damage turn varies from 8 to 10 seconds. If the target is neutral to fire damage, it does 10 damage to creatures, and only half (5 damage), to players.

This spell takes into account the Level and Melee ( Axe , Club or Sword ) skill level to determine how much damage you will deal to the target. It does only one-fourth of damage to players, from the amount of damage it does to creatures. The damage is not based upon the melee skill level of the type of weapon you are wielding, but rather on the highest melee skill level of your character. So if you want to effectively use this spell, then the smart play is to always try to use it when in a Blood Rage . The damage range is wide. For a single loose reference point, a level 350 with 100 skill level will cause between 580 and 880 total damage. Useful for long-winded single battles, as it can supersede the damage of Brutal Strike after 5 - 6 turns. Also useful for continuously turning invisible creatures visible again.
A mage's primary healing spell. When cast by a high level mage it restores about 50% more health than Light Healing .

Can be used to provide extra healing when hunting stronger creatures. This spell is similar to Recovery in the sense that it is a heal over time, but heals for twice as much and costs slightly over twice as much mana.
Very useful as a last resort to healing. Note the long cooldown.

This is a very handy spell and should be purchased as soon as possible. (The Stealth Ring produces the same effect.) Be aware certain creatures can "see invisibility," i.e. they are immune to it. Dark Magicians can cancel this spell by turning the player into a broom. This spell cannot make the caster invisible to players.

attributes.words: exani hur up exani hur down

notes.text: The red squares shows where to stand when levitating up beside entrances. Very useful spell. Instead of using a stack of Parcels , you can use this spell to climb onto ledges or houses. Advantages of this spell include no need to carry parcels and a greater ability to go up in certain places! In an archway, you need to stand on 3 parcels and have something blocking you from walking underneath the archway instead of on top of it.  Levitate does not have this issue. Warning note : In some places you can levitate up or down after cuting grass but if the grass grows back again you won't be able to levitate over it, and you will end up trapped. Try the spell on flat walls or in front of doorway openings. The caster must be facing the cliff, wall or entrance for this spell to work.  The caster cannot move up or down more than one level at a time.  If this spell is cast and the character is not in the correct square to levitate, then no mana is lost.

A rather weak, but popular and efficient healing spell. Cast by a high level mage, it has about 25% of the power of Ultimate Healing . It was the only healing spell available for knights for many years until Wound Cleansing was introduced in the Winter Update 2007 . Knights can't use it since the Winter Update 2010 . Learning Light Healing used to cost 170 gp , but since the Winter Update 2012 it is free. A player casting the Light Healing spell
This spell belongs to the Special Spells secondary group, therefore it shares cooldown with Strong Energy Strike and Strong Flame Strike .

A lighter version of Light Healing , particularly useful as a cheap way to cancel paralysis. It used to be obtainable exclusively on Dawnport . However, it was made freely available on mainland on November 19th, 2014, thanks to a successful proposal by Trimegis .

This spell was rendered mostly obsolete by the Summer Update 2005 . You may now climb up using a rope , even if the "rope spot" is stacked with objects or occupied by a creature or player (even if you yourself are standing on it). This spell can not pull up items, such as a loot bag. It is recommended that you always carry a rope when exploring caves.

It's extremely handy for Mages . Note that mana blocked hits do not increase Magic Level . While this spell is active, all damage received will be displayed in the Game console as Blue Text and the following icon will appear in your condition bar: . The Magic Shield only absorbs a limited amount of damage before breaking. When this mana is depleted the spell effect disappears. The amount of mana it absorbs depends on the character's Level and Magic Level , including equipment and skill boosts active at the moment the spell is cast, according to this formula (rounded up to the next whole number), where L is your level and M is your magic level: M a g i c S h i e l d C a p a c i t y = 7 M + 7.6 L + max { 300 , 0.4 L } {\displaystyle Magic Shield Capacity = 7M + 7.6L + \max\{300, 0.4L \}} If you have unlocked the Enhanced Magic Shield Conviction Perk on the Sorcerers' Wheel of Destiny , then the formula is: M a g i c S h i e l d C a p a c i t y = 8 M + 8.6 L + max { 300 , 0.4 L } {\displaystyle Magic Shield Capacity = 8M + 8.6L + \max\{300, 0.4L \}} Recasting the spell restores the shield to its maximum value. While the spell is on cooldown, mages can renew the shield by using a Magic Shield Potion . The Magic Shield can be removed by casting the Cancel Magic Shield spell.

Heals all players and summons at a 4 tile radius, including the caster. The healing value changes according to the caster's level and magic level . Very useful when you are hunting in a team to heal everyone at the same time. Also very useful if you hunt with summons.

A weaker version of Terra Strike . It used to be obtainable exclusively on Dawnport . However, it was made freely available on the mainland on November 19th, 2014, thanks to a successful proposal by Trimegis . This spell is taught to druids on Dawnport and can also be learned for free from any druid trainer on the mainland. A very helpful spell for players without a Premium Account , as they do not have access to regular Strike spells.
Obtained when using the Shrine of Respect in Tyrsung during The Way of the Monk Quest .

This spell is a stronger version of Heal Friend and heals approximately double the amount of health. Since it has a long cooldown, it's used specially in emergencies when the target player (usually a Knight) is on very low HP.

The druid 's equivalent of the sorcerer 's Death Strike . Unlike other Strike spells however, its damage is affected by the target's armor and defense. To compensate for that, it has a higher base damage.
Salbra can teach you this spell during the Festival of Initiates . You will deal ~11 damage.
Salbra can teach you this spell for free, during the Festival of Initiates .
The needed mana to cast this spell depends on the amount of party members that will be affected.
You can't use this and Blood Rage spell at the same time, one spell will cancel the other. Makes it easier to block strong monsters and bosses.

This spell, together with Hell's Core , replaced the old Ultimate Explosion spell in the Winter Update 2007 . Rage of the Skies is considered to be more useful overall, due to dealing virtually equal damage, while costing almost 50% less mana and the fact that many high-levelled monsters are immune to fire damage . Rage of the Skies is the sorcerer 's equivalent of the druid 's Wrath of Nature , compared to which it has a smaller area of effect, but deals about 10% more damage and costs 100 mana less. Casting this spell puts ALL combat spells on a 4-second cooldown.
Very useful spell because it heals more hp than Exura Ico , although the drawback is the healing isn't instant.

Stronger than the standard Ultimate Healing spell, Restoration heals about 40% more with smaller range, meaning it's more likely to heal you for a value close its average. On the other hand, it has a long cooldown and thus can't be used as a replacement for the weaker spell. It's useful in dangerous situations for high level mages where even casting Exura Vita isn't enough to heal back to full health.

This spell shares the Crippling Cooldown Group group with Expose Weakness . Creatures can only suffer from one instance of Sap Strength at a time, which means that the effect cannot be stacked even if two or more sorcerers use it at the same time. This spell has no effect against other characters. Unlike other area spells, the center of the affected area is the target creature, and the caster if no target is set. This is one of the spells added with the 2020 Vocation Adjustments . It's main object is to make Sorcerers more meaningful and distinct during team hunts.

A weaker variant of Fire Wave and the sorcerer 's equivalent of the druid 's Chill Out . It used to be obtainable exclusively on Dawnport . However, it was made freely available on the mainland on November 19th, 2014, thanks to a successful proposal by Trimegis .

This spell increases the distance skill of the paladin by 40% of his unmodified distance skill. That is, 40% of the distance skill if there are no boosts obtained from spells, equipment or other items. The increase rounds up if the unmodified distance skill is an odd number. This spell applies a paralysis on the paladin, and a 10 second cooldown to both the healing and support channels, preventing the player from healing himself or dispelling the paralysis with Haste . Other players can still heal the paladin to dispel his paralysis, but they cannot affect the cooldowns. Equipment bonuses stack with Sharpshooter's effects, but the gains from Sharpshooter are lost if another magical buff is applied to your distance, such as distance reduction from monsters or from Bullseye Potions . Likewise, if a buff is already active, whether positive or negative, it will be overwritten by Sharpshooter, and even if Sharpshooter wears off, the previous buff will not be reapplied.
This spell belongs to the Special Spells secondary group, therefore it shares its cooldown with Lightning and Strong Flame Strike .
This spell belongs to the Special Spells secondary group, therefore it shares its cooldown with Lightning and Strong Energy Strike .

It's useful to escape from strong monsters that you don't want to fight. When needing to travel a long distance, this can help out a lot in decreasing the traveling time. However, in some cases this spell wont affect the traveling time, see Speed Breakpoints for more information.
This spell belongs to the Special Spells secondary group, therefore it shares its cooldown with Strong Terra Strike .

One of the strongest spells available to druids . Along with Terra Wave , Strong Ice Wave is the druid 's equivalent of the sorcerer 's Energy Wave . While it has a longer cooldown than Terra Wave, it has a lower mana cost and deals about 25% more damage. It is virtually equal to Energy Wave, but has a shorter range than both.
This spell belongs to the Special Spells secondary group, therefore it shares its cooldown with Strong Ice Strike .
One of the most useful spells . Change "creature name" for a creature to make it appear and help you. See also: Summoned Creature - a more complete guide to summons.
This spell has no notes.
This spell has no notes.
This spell has no notes.
This spell has no notes.

Unlocking it at higher stages grants additional damage to targets with more than 60% of their hit points , and reduces its cooldown . This is a Revelation Perk granted through the Wheel of Destiny . Therefore, it has no gold cost and is not learned from any specific NPC .
One of the most often used spells when fighting creatures vulnerable to earth damage , as it deals relatively high damage and costs very little mana.

One of the strongest spells available to druids . Along with Strong Ice Wave , Terra Wave is the druid 's equivalent of the sorcerer 's Energy Wave . While it has a higher mana cost and deals about 25% less damage than Energy Wave and Strong Ice Wave, it has a longer range than the latter and a shorter cooldown than both.
The needed mana to cast this spell depends on the amount of party members that will be affected.

This spell is meant to be used primarily as a finishing move because of the cost and the fact that casting it puts ALL combat spells on a 4-second cooldown. Considering that the spell's damage range is rather significant, many players prefer to cast two or three Flame Strikes instead.

A mage's go-to healing spell in dangerous situations. At a high level, this spell will restore about two times as much health as Intense Healing and about four times as much as Light Healing . Since the Winter Update 2007 , when holy spells were introduced, Ultimate Healing became useless for paladins , as Divine Healing restores significantly more health while costing only 50 mana more. For that reason, it was eventually made available only for mages. This spell should not be used at a low level, because Intense Healing will restore almost all of a mage's health at a much lower cost.

This spell is meant to be used primarily as a finishing move because of the cost and the fact that casting it puts ALL combat spells on a 4-second cooldown. Considering that the spell's damage range is rather significant, many players prefer to cast two or three Ice Strikes instead.
This spell lights the dark at a radius of 4 tiles and it lasts for 33 minutes.

This spell is meant to be used primarily as a finishing move because of the cost and the fact that casting it puts ALL combat spells on a 4-second cooldown. Considering that the spell's damage range is rather significant, many players prefer to cast two or three Terra Strikes instead.

Toggle spell, can be used interchangeably with Virtue of Justice and Virtue of Sustain . Only one of these 3 Virtues can be active at once. It stays active until another Virtue is cast. Active Virtue spell icon has a yellow border on the action bar .

Toggle spell, can be used interchangeably with Virtue of Harmony and Virtue of Sustain . Only one of these 3 Virtues can be active at once. It stays active until another Virtue is cast. Active Virtue spell icon has a yellow border on the action bar .

Toggle spell, can be used interchangeably with Virtue of Harmony and Virtue of Justice . Only one of these 3 Virtues can be active at once. It stays active until another Virtue is cast. Active Virtue spell icon has a yellow border on the action bar .

A knight 's only long-range offensive ability. It is slightly weaker than Brutal Strike , but it has an attack range of 5 square meters. The animation will change depending on the weapon type you are wielding. It will look like throwing a Blacksteel Sword when wielding a sword , a Royal Axe when wielding an axe and a Cranial Basher when wielding a club .
Wound Cleansing is the primary healing spell for Knights .

This spell, together with Eternal Winter , replaced the old Poison Storm spell in the Winter Update 2007 . Wrath of Nature is considered to be less useful overall, because, even though it costs 350 mana less, it deals lower damage and many high-levelled monsters are immune to earth damage . Wrath of Nature is the druid 's equivalent of the sorcerer 's Rage of the Skies , compared to which it has a larger area of effect, but costs 100 mana more and deals about 10% less damage. Casting this spell puts ALL combat spells on a 4-second cooldown.

Most creatures that can be summoned can also be convinced. Monks are an exception, as well as anything that has the potential to cause damage over time because they were exploited in many PvP traps. See the article on the Summon Creature spell for more information. The following is a list of creatures that can be convinced, but cannot be summoned.

row: melee (0-124) , throwing star (28-38) , intoxicate (3 seconds) , invisible (2 seconds) , haste .
melee (0-170) , throwing star (0-150) , musical strike (reduces melee by 75%) .
melee (0-300+) , life drain (0-100+) , small life drain wave (61-160+) , soulfire ball (8~ turns) .

notes.text: These runes used to be used by low level knights, before they reached magic level 4 and could use the Ultimate Healing Rune (Item) .
See Notes from Magic Wall Rune . Casting this spell causes a Magic Wall Effect or Magic Wall (Neutral) .

Salbra is the only one who knows this spell, she supposedly casts it in order to create Practise Magic Missile Runes and hand them to players during the Festival of Initiates . Although no character can learn this spell, it could be seem in Flash Client 's spell list. It is a weaker version of the Light Magic Missile .
See Notes from Wild Growth Rune .
